intro: Diodia scabra, commonly known as rough diodia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks. It has a long flowering period, usually from late spring to early fall, and is known for its aromatic foliage. Diodia scabra is also used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported medicinal properties.
